SEARCH

Class Arc

java.lang.Object
Arc
public class Arc extends Object
An arc that can be manipulated and that draws itself on a canvas.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Arc()
    Create a new arc at default position with default color.
    Arc(int x, int y, int diameter, int arcStartAngle, int arcEndAngle, String color, boolean visible)
    Create an arc at a given position with specified color and shape

  • Constructor Details

    • Arc

      public Arc()
      Create a new arc at default position with default color.

    • Arc

      public Arc(int x, int y, int diameter, int arcStartAngle, int arcEndAngle, String color, boolean visible)
      Create an arc at a given position with specified color and shape
      Parameters:
      x - the x location of the Arc
      y - the y location of the Arc
      diameter - the diameter of the Arc
      arcStartAngle - the angle the arc sweep starts at
      arcEndAngle - the angle the arc sweep ends at
      color - the name of the color for the Arc
      visible - true displays the Arc on the canvas

  • Method Details

    • makeVisible

      public void makeVisible()
      Make this arc visible. If it was already visible, do nothing.

    • makeInvisible

      public void makeInvisible()
      Make this arc invisible. If it was already invisible, do nothing.

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Determine if the arc should be showing on the canvas
      Returns:
      true if the shape is not hidden

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight()
      Move the arc a few pixels to the right.

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft()
      Move the arc a few pixels to the left.

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp()
      Move the arc a few pixels up.

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown()
      Move the arc a few pixels down.

    • moveHorizontal

      public void moveHorizontal(int distance)
      Move the arc horizontally by 'distance' pixels.
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance to move along the x axis, positive to the right

    • moveVertical

      public void moveVertical(int distance)
      Move the arc vertically by 'distance' pixels.
      Parameters:
      distance - the distance to move along the y axis, positive down

    • setX

      public void setX(int xPosition)
      Move the arc horizontally to a given X location
      Parameters:
      xPosition - the new X location to move the arc to

    • setY

      public void setY(int yPosition)
      Move the arc vertically to a given Y location
      Parameters:
      yPosition - the new Y location to move the arc to

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int x, int y)
      Move the arc to a given (X, Y) coordinate
      Parameters:
      x - the new X location to move to
      y - the new Y location to move to

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Determine the current X location of the arc
      Returns:
      the current X location of the arc

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Determine the current Y location of the arc
      Returns:
      the current Y location of the arc

    • openArc

      public void openArc()
      Open the arc a bit.

    • closeArc

      public void closeArc()
      Close the arc a bit.

    • changeArcBeginning

      public void changeArcBeginning(int angle)
      Change the beginning angle of the arc
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle at which the arc should start, 0° to the right, increasing counterclockwise

    • changeArcEnd

      public void changeArcEnd(int angle)
      Change the ending angle of the arc
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle at which the arc should end, 0° to the right, increasing counterclockwise

    • getArcBeginning

      public int getArcBeginning()
      Determine the angle at which the arc starts
      Returns:
      the angle (in degrees) of the beginning of the arc, 0° to the right, increasing counterclockwise

    • getArcEnd

      public int getArcEnd()
      Determine the angle at which the arc ends
      Returns:
      the angle (in degrees) of the end of the arc, 0° to the right, increasing counterclockwise

    • getArcLength

      public int getArcLength()
      Determine the angle enclosed by the arc
      Returns:
      the angle (in degrees) the arc traces counterclockwise

    • changeSize

      public void changeSize(int newDiameter)
      Change the size of the arc to the new size (in pixels). Size must be >= 0.
      Parameters:
      newDiameter - the new diameter for the arc

    • getDiameter

      public int getDiameter()
      Determine the current diameter of the arc
      Returns:
      the current diameter of the arc

    • changeColor

      public void changeColor(String newColor)
      Change the color. Valid colors are "red", "yellow", "blue", "green", "magenta", "cyan", "brown", "white", and "black", or rgb hex strings "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, bb are 2-hexit values for red, green, and blue levels.
      Parameters:
      newColor - a lower case string naming the color for the arc
